decision_conditions: The proposed single storey rear extension, by reason of its rearward projection and siting, would be overbearing and visually obtrusive and would be detrimental to the amenities of the neighbouring occupiers at No 26 Edward Road, due to a loss of light and outlook, contrary to Policy DM1 of the Development Management Policies Local Plan document (2013) and the relevant provisions of the adopted Harrow Supplementary Planning Document Residential Design Guide (2010).

The proposed first-floor side extension,
by reason of its siting (close proximity to the party boundary with no step-in),
would create a terracing effect and erode the openness and characteristic
features found throughout the streetscene. Its proposed hipped-roof design and
combined width would fail to harmonise well with the existing, and would form an incongruous, discordant, contrived, unduly bulky and
dominant addition to the host dwelling and street scene. The proposal would
thereby be contrary to the high quality design aspirations of the National
Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policies D3.D(1) and D3.D(11) of The London
Plan (2021), Core Policy CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012), Policy DM1
A., DM1 B. (a), (b) and (c) of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local
Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design
Guide (2010).
description: Two storey side extension; single storey side to rear extension (Demolition of attached garage)
